Steve O’Connor CV

Senior UX Designer with 15+ years of experience creating accessible, user-focused digital services across public and private sectors.

Passionate about crafting intuitive, inclusive, and user-centred digital experiences. Skilled in prototyping, usability testing, user research, journey mapping, and the development of accessible solutions in Agile environments. Experienced with design systems and cross-functional collaboration, with a strong foundation in interaction design, branding, and service design. Committed to continuous learning, mentoring, and delivering engaging, user-driven outcomes.

Core Skills

  • Accessible Design (WCAG, ARIA)
  • User Experience (UX) & Interaction Design
  • Prototyping (Figma, Axure, GOV.UK kit)
  • HTML/CSS collaboration & Front-End awareness
  • Design systems & pattern libraries
  • Team mentoring & leadership
  • Creative development & strategic thinking
  • Agile development environments
  • User research & usability testing
  • Journey mapping & service design
  • Visual & brand identity design

Experience

Principal UX Designer, Nexer Digital

(Mar 2024 — Present, Cambridge, UK)

  • Leading UX quality assurance initiatives and optimising cross-team collaboration.
  • >Championing accessible, user-first design practices aligned with WCAG standards.
  • Developing design systems to support scalable, inclusive product development
  • Plus what I was doing as a Senior UX Designer.

Senior UX Designer, Nexer Digital

(Mar 2017 — Mar 2024, Cambridge, UK)

  • Delivered accessible, inclusive digital solutions for clients including the Department for Education (DfE), Mind, AstraZeneca, and Research Data Scotland
  • Conducted extensive user research, journey mapping, and iterative usability testing
  • Developed interactive prototypes in Figma and Axure to validate and enhance designs
  • Collaborated closely with product managers, developers, researchers in agile teams
  • Led the redesign of Mind charity’s donation flow—increasing online donations by 70%
  • Contributed to cross-gov initiatives, including design ops and the GDS Design System.

CamCreatives, Director and Community Organiser

2006–present

  • Organise creative meetups, events for creative minds in Cambridge
  • Support local collaboration, mentoring, and creative careers

Lead Designer, Airsource

(Sep 2010 — Mar 2017, Cambridge, UK)

  • Introduced structured UX and UI processes to a development-focused agency
  • Led mobile app and web interface redesigns improved client KPIs and user satisfaction
  • Developed brand and design system guidelines for mobile and digital products.

Graphic and Web Design Consultant, stevethedesigner

(Nov 2008 — Sep 2010, Cambridge, UK)

Delivered end-to-end branding, UX, and web design projects for local and international businesses.

Earlier roles

  • Studio print and web designer at Cream Group Ltd.
  • Graphic and web design consultant at Guido Design
  • Graphic Designer at Logotron Ltd.
  • 2D/3D Software trainer and design manager at Vellum Software UK Ltd.

Education & Certifications

  • BA Hons in Graphic Design — University of Central Lancashire (Unfinished)
  • B-TEC Graphic Design - Southport Techical College (Distinction)
